member.name: T:Breeze.ContextProvider.BreezeMetadataValidator
member.summary: Validates entities using Breeze metadata.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.BreezeMetadataValidator.#ctor(Breeze.ContextProvider.ContextProvider,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object}})
member.summary: Create a new instance.
member.param: Used for getting entity keys for building EntityError objects.
Contains the validator information for properties of entity and complex types.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.BreezeMetadataValidator.#ctor(Breeze.ContextProvider.ContextProvider,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Create a new instance.
member.param: Used for getting entity keys for building EntityError objects.
Contains breeze metadata. The structuralTypeList is extracted from it.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.BreezeMetadataValidator.ValidateEntities(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.List{Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo}},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Validate all the entities in the saveMap.
member.param: Map of type to entities.
If true, throws an EntityErrorsException if any entity is invalid
member.exception: Contains all the EntityErrors. Only thrown if throwIfInvalid is true.
member.returns: List containing an EntityError for each failed validation.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.BreezeMetadataValidator.ValidateEntity(Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo,System.Collections.Generic.List{Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityError})
member.summary: Validates a single entity. Skips validation (returns true) if entity is marked Deleted.
member.param: contains the entity to validate
An EntityError is added to this list for each error found in the entity
member.returns: true if entity is valid, false if invalid.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.DataAnnotationsValidator.#ctor(Breeze.ContextProvider.ContextProvider)
member.summary: Create a new instance.
member.param: Used for getting entity keys for building EntityError objects.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.DataAnnotationsValidator.ValidateEntities(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.List{Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo}},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Validate all the entities in the saveMap.
member.param: Map of type to entities.
If true, throws an EntityErrorsException if any entity is invalid
member.exception: Contains all the EntityErrors. Only thrown if throwIfInvalid is true.
member.returns: List containing an EntityError for each failed validation.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.DataAnnotationsValidator.ValidateEntity(Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo,System.Collections.Generic.List{Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityError})
member.summary: Validates a single entity. Skips validation (returns true) if entity is marked Deleted.
member.param: contains the entity to validate
An EntityError is added to this list for each error found in the entity
member.returns: true if entity is valid, false if invalid.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.ContextProvider.GetDbConnection
member.summary: Should only be called from BeforeSaveEntities and AfterSaveEntities.
member.returns: Open DbConnection used by the ContextProvider's implementation

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.ContextProvider.OpenDbConnection
member.summary: Internal use only. Should only be called by ContextProvider during SaveChanges. Opens the DbConnection used by the ContextProvider's implementation. Method must be idempotent; after it is called the first time, subsequent calls have no effect.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.ContextProvider.CloseDbConnection
member.summary: Internal use only. Should only be called by ContextProvider during SaveChanges. Closes the DbConnection used by the ContextProvider's implementation.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.ContextProvider.BeforeSaveEntity(Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo)
member.summary: The method is called for each entity to be saved before the save occurs. If this method returns 'false' then the entity will be excluded from the save. The base implementation returns the result of BeforeSaveEntityDelegate, or 'true' if BeforeSaveEntityDelegate is null.
member.returns: true to include the entity in the save, false to exclude

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.ContextProvider.BeforeSaveEntities(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.List{Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo}})
member.summary: Called after BeforeSaveEntity, and before saving the entities to the persistence layer. Allows adding, changing, and removing entities prior to save. The base implementation returns the result of BeforeSaveEntitiesDelegate, or the unchanged saveMap if BeforeSaveEntitiesDelegate is null.
member.param: A List of EntityInfo for each Type
member.returns: The EntityInfo for each entity that should be saved

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.ContextProvider.AfterSaveEntities(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.List{Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo}},System.Collections.Generic.List{Breeze.ContextProvider.KeyMapping})
member.summary: Called after the entities have been saved, and all the temporary keys have been replaced by real keys. The base implementation calls AfterSaveEntitiesDelegate, or does nothing if AfterSaveEntitiesDelegate is null.
member.param: The same saveMap that was returned from BeforeSaveEntities
The mapping of temporary keys to real keys

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.DynamicTypeInfo.BuildDynamicTypeName
member.summary: The type name generated must be the same even if generated during different sessions ( so no part can be random or based on the current time) because this same name may be sent to the server by multiple clients and the server needs to understand that these are all the same type.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.DynamicTypeInfo.CalcStringHash(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a hash encoded as a string with the chars (A-Z,A-z,0-9,_) only. Under the covers this method returns an 128 bit hash code calculated using SHA1. This code is then encoded into an approx Base64 encode of the chars listed above. This will usually be approx 28 chars in length, which may then be truncated based on the maxChars parameter. This method can process approx 100K 300 char strings a second.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.TransactionSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Create a TransactionSettings object using default settings.
member.remarks: Defaults the to ReadCommitted, the to TransactionManager.DefaultTimeout (which is usually 1 minute), and to TransactionType.None (which means the other settings have no effect). These settings are not Breeze requirements and can be changed using the appropriate constructor or setter.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.TransactionSettings.#ctor(System.Transactions.IsolationLevel,System.TimeSpan,Breeze.ContextProvider.TransactionType)
member.summary: Create a TransactionSettings object with the specified settings.
member.remarks: Note that IsolationLevel and Timeout have no affect if TransactionType is None.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.TransactionSettings.ToTransactionOptions
member.summary: Converts the TransactionSettings to a instance.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.TransactionSettings.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: See .

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.TransactionSettings.GetHashCode
member.summary: See .
member.returns: A hash code for the current .

member.name: F:Breeze.ContextProvider.TransactionSettings.IsolationMap
member.summary: Maps the System.Transactions.IsolationLevel to System.Data.IsolationLevel

member.name: P:Breeze.ContextProvider.TransactionSettings.Default
member.summary: Default settings for all saves.
member.remarks: The Default provides default transaction settings for all SaveChanges actions. Override BreezeConfig to return a different TransactionSettings value. You can supply settings for a particular save with the TransactionSettings passed in the SaveChanges call.

member.name: P:Breeze.ContextProvider.TransactionSettings.TransactionType
member.summary: What type of transaction to use when performing saves. The transaction wraps the BeforeSaveEntity/ies, SaveChangesCore, and AfterSaveEntities methods so all work can be commited or rolled back together.

member.name: P:Breeze.ContextProvider.TransactionSettings.IsolationLevel
member.summary: Gets the transaction locking behavior.
member.remarks: Only applicable if is not None. The default IsolationLevel is ReadCommitted.

member.name: P:Breeze.ContextProvider.TransactionSettings.IsolationLevelAs
member.summary: Gets the transaction locking behavior as a System.Data.IsolationLevel.
member.remarks: Only applicable if is not None. The default IsolationLevel is ReadCommitted.

member.name: P:Breeze.ContextProvider.TransactionSettings.Timeout
member.summary: Gets the timeout period for the TransactionScope transaction.
member.remarks: Only applicable if is TransactionScope. The default Timeout is TransactionManager.DefaultTimeout which is usually 1 minute. See http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6402031/transactionscope-maximumtimeout

summary.list: TransactionScope - Use the ambient .NET TransactionScope object. Necessary for distributed transactions. DbTransaction - Use the transaction from the DbConnection. Only works against the single connection. None - BeforeSaveEntity/ies, SaveChangesCore, and AfterSaveEntities are not executed in the same transaction.
